cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW, cross the Yucatan Channel, then accelerate northward through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast, most likely along the southeast Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect only for Pinar del Rio, Cuba (no U.S. coastline yet)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in the United States at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to the Florida Panhandle lies within the day-4/5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Low (21%) chance of sustained 34-kt winds by late Wed/early Thu with a smaller 5% chance of 50-kt winds; intensity could rise in later advisories if Zeta strengthens in the Gulf.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Zeta reaches hurricane strength in the central Gulf, a storm surge of several feet (potentially >3 ft) is possible along southeast Louisiana including the Lower Mississippi River and Barataria Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall totals of 4–8 inches are possible near and east of the track, which would include the Port of South Louisiana late Wed–Thu.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and short-fuse flash-flooding are possible during closest approach.
